title: Japanese skincare: could this £700 cream 'smart age' your skin?
text:
Finally, Clé de Peau Beauté has arrived exclusively in Harrods' revamped beauty hall. While you may not have heard of Japan's number-one skincare brand, among aficionados, this is the most talked about launch in a decade, if not two.

Ever since Clé de Peau burst on to the scene in 1982, the world's top make-up artists, models and editors have been acquiring its hero products on trips to the US and Japan. Indeed, I recall boarding the Eurostar to Paris with two beauty-editor colleagues in the early noughties to stock up on its coveted concealer stick when news broke of a Clé de Peau pop-up shop. And that was before the likes of Rosie Huntington-Whiteley and supermodel Amber Valletta had spoken...
description: Finally, Clé de Peau Beauté has arrived exclusively in Harrods' revamped beauty hall.
